block_comment: This instruction block essentially assigns a constant low value (0) to the `D_ctrl_intr_inst` signal. This is implemented by using the "assign" keyword which in Verilog is mainly used to drive values into a wire. It assigns a digitally low value "1'b0" to the `D_ctrl_intr_inst` wire, meaning that no matter what condition or situation the code finds itself in, the signal `D_ctrl_intr_inst` will always be low which signifies inactive or off in digital schematic.
